The '''East Road''',<ref>{{FR|Conspiracy}}, p. 66</ref> also known as the '''East-West Road''',<ref name="Shadow">{{FR|Shadow}}, p. 43</ref><ref name="UTNote6">{{UT|7a}}, note 6</ref><ref>{{UT|Map}}, label next to the road</ref> the '''Great Road''',<ref name="Eriador">{{App|Eriador}}, p. 1039</ref>  the '''Old Road''',<ref>{{FR|Knife}}, p. 183 and p. 186</ref><ref>{{HM|UI}}, entry ''Old Road'', p. 168</ref> or the '''great East Road''' east of the [[Brandywine Bridge]],<ref name="UI">{{HM|UI}}, entry ''East Road'', p. 75</ref><ref>{{FR|Forest}}. p. 113</ref><ref>[[Christopher Tolkien]], [[General Map of Middle-earth]], label next to the road</ref> was a great ancient road in [[Eriador]] that ran from the [[Grey Havens]] to [[Rivendell]].<ref name="UI" />

==Course==
The western end of the Road was the [[Grey Havens]]<ref name="Shadow" /> near the [[Blue Mountains]].<ref name="Map">{{FR|Map}}</ref> The East Road passed through the Shire, and two of its most important towns, [[Hobbiton]] and [[Michel Delving]], lay athwart the road.<ref>{{FR|Part}}</ref> Just northeast where the East Road crossed the [[Greenway]] was the town of [[Bree]].<ref name="Map" /> A day's journey east of Bree on the East Road was [[The Forsaken Inn]]. The [[Ford of Bruinen]] near [[Rivendell]] was a twelve days long march east of Bree on the East Road.<ref>{{FR|Knife}}, p. 187</ref>

==History==
It is not recorded when and by whom the East Road was built. It is possible that Dwarves had used the East Road or a path that followed the course of the East Road since the [[First Age]]. 

[[Dwarves]] had lived in the underground cities of [[Nogrod]] and [[Belegost]] in the [[Blue Mountains]] since the First Age.<ref>{{S|Sindar}}</ref> At the end of the First Age during the [[War of Wrath]] between the forces of the [[Valar]] and the forces of [[Morgoth]] great earthquakes caused the western parts of [[Beleriand]] west of the Blue Mountains to sink beneath the sea and created a gap in the south of the Blue Mountains into which a gulf of the sea flowed. The earthquakes also caused the river [[Lhûn|Lune]] to change its course and flowed into the new gulf. The Elves built the [[Grey Havens]] at the eastern end of the gulf, which was named the [[Gulf of Lune]].<ref name="Rings">{{S|Rings}}</ref> As a result of the events Nogrod and Belegost were ruined and many of their inhabitants fled to the underground dwarven city of [[Khazad-dûm]] in the [[Misty Mountains]] in the east.<ref>{{App|Durin}}, p. 1071</ref>

In the First Age the [[Durin's Folk|Longbeard Dwarves]] of Khazad-dûm and their kin from the [[Iron Hills]] began to build a road from the [[Great Gates|east gate]] of Khazad-dûm north along the eastern skirts of the Misty Mountains over the upper part of the [[Gladden River]] to the southernmost point where a bridge over the river [[Anduin]] could be constructed and then eastwards on a stone bridge over the Anduin east across the valley of the Anduin through [[Mirkwood]] to a bridge over the [[River Running]] and then over open land north-east to the iron mines<ref name="NM">{{NM|P3xx}}, pp. 372-73</ref> in the Iron Hills.<ref>{{PM|XNotes}}, note 30</ref>

Near the end of the [[Third Age]] at the time of the [[Quest of Erebor]] a road ran near the valley of Rivendell eastwards to the [[High Pass]].<ref>{{H|Hill}}, first and second paragraph</ref> It is possible that this road had been made a long time ago. At the time of the [[War of the Last Alliance]] at the end of the [[Second Age]] an "ancient" road ran down from the High Pass and that the bridge over the Anduin that it led to was enlarged and strengthened so that the armies of the [[Last Alliance of Elves and Men]] could pass over it.<ref>{{UT|7a}}, note 14</ref>

Records from the time of the [[War of the Ring]] at the end of the Third Age refer to [[Hobbits]] working the fields on both side of the "Dwarves' ancestral road to the" Blue Mountains<ref>{{UT|9b}}</ref> and state that dwarves had "always" travelled on the East Road to their mines in the Blue Mountains.<ref name="Shadow" />

After the [[Númenóreans|Númenórean]] realm-in-exile of [[Arnor]] was founded, the East Road from the Grey Havens to Rivendell and the [[North-South Road|great road]] that connected [[Fornost]] with the second Númenorean realm-in-exile of [[Gondor]] were the only "Númenórean roads" in the north-west of [[Middle-earth]].<ref name="UTNote6" />

After Arnor was divided in {{TA|861}}, the East Road formed the boundary between two of its successor states, [[Cardolan]] and [[Rhudaur]]. During the [[Angmar War|War with Angmar]], [[Arthedain]] and Cardolan tried to maintain a frontier along the [[Weather Hills]], the East Road, and the lower [[Hoarwell]] against [[Angmar]] and Rhudaur.<ref>{{App|Eriador}}, ''The North-kingdom and the Dúnedain'', p. 1040</ref>

By the late [[Third Age]], the most notable users of the road were the [[Dwarves]] who travelled to and from the [[Blue Mountains]].<ref name="Eriador" /> Those often stopped at [[Bree]], and when they traversed [[the Shire]], it was said that they brought news from the world outside, thus becoming the main link between the Shire and other realms.<ref name="Shadow" /><ref>{{FR|Sign}}</ref>

[[File:Steven White Jr. - East Road.png|1000px|frameless|center|East Road]]

==Other versions of the legendarium==
Originally, the Road made two large curves: a great loop south of Weathertop to the North-east and then "bent back again southward towards the [[Bruinen|River]]" around the bottom of the [[Trollshaws]]. 

Because of [[Christopher Tolkien]]'s "carelessness", in the [[1954]] [[General Map of Middle-earth|published map]], the Road has only a small northward curve between Weathertop and the [[Last Bridge]], and then runs in a straight line to the [[Ford of Bruinen]]. In the [[Second Edition]] onwards, in order to agree with the map, the portion of the text was corrected to "the Road behind held on its way to the River Bruinen".<ref>{{RS|1XIa}}</ref>

The relevant map in [[Barbara Strachey]]'s atlas ''[[Journeys of Frodo]]'' reflects the earlier descriptions.

==Portrayal in adaptations==

'''2007: ''[[The Lord of the Rings Online]]'':'''
:The Great East Road runs through the regions of the [[Shire]], [[Bree-land]], [[Lone-lands]], and [[Trollshaws]].

'''2012: [[The Hobbit: An Unexpected Journey]]:''' 
:While the [[Thorin and Company|Company of Thorin Oakenshield]] is in [[Rivendell]], Gandalf mentions to [[Elrond|Lord Elrond]] that they were travelling on the Great East Road. It is also said that they found the swords [[Orcrist]] and [[Glamdring]] in a troll-hoard on the self-same road.
